text: <!channel> As discussed on the last HL Arch WG on Wednesday - the proposal for the next consensus architecture is posted here: <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/wiki/Next-Consensus-Architecture-Proposal>

attachments.title: hyperledger/fabric
attachments.text: fabric - Fabric is a blockchain project in Incubation proposed to the community and documented at <https://goo.gl/RYQZ5N>. Information on what Incubation entails can be found in the Hyperledger Proj...

text: please review, comment, discuss and contribute

<@U0Y14MWA2>:  looks great! btw... I know it is a "fact", but it is  probably not that clear in the document that channels are decentralized; I feel there is some disconnect between 2.4 & 2.5; some people had asked "which entity will run the channel that consenters are subscribing to"

<@U0UL07VSL> it is in fact consenters that implement the (consensus) channel to which peers are subscribing to. Although in production deployments a consensus channel will surely be decentralized (will make sure this is clear in the document) in fact the channel could even be centralized (e.g., for development and testing purposes). In any case consensus channel is *logically* centralized and abstracted away from peers.
